node.description: What we watched, read, listened to and cooked this year.
node.content: ["Welcome. When my streaming music service of choice fed me its annual report of my most-listened-to songs from the past year, many were by the pianist Hania Rani. I was unfamiliar with Rani\u2019s work until one of my colleagues, the art director Jaspal Riyait, included Rani\u2019s \u201cF Major\u201d in her Best of 2020 picks.", "This weekend, if you\u2019re celebrating Christmas or not; if you\u2019re gathering safely or not gathering at all; if you\u2019re staying at home or venturing away, I hope you\u2019ll find something to entertain or inspire or delight you in the At Home and Away team\u2019s selections for the Best of 2021. These are the books, movies, TV shows, recipes, snacks and other stuff that helped my colleagues lead a full and cultured life over the past year. Perhaps within there\u2019s an artist, an idea, a habit that will help you do so in the year to come.", "What\u2019s on your best of 2021 list? Write to us: athome@nytimes.com. Include your full name and location and we might include your contribution in an upcoming newsletter. We\u2019re At Home and Away. We\u2019ll read every letter sent. As always, more ideas for how to pass the time this weekend appear below. I\u2019ll be back next week.", "Times subscribers can sign up here to receive this newsletter twice a week. There\u2019s more to read, do and watch in our archive. Let us know what you think."]
